professional_experience: Song Chong is the Professor and Head of the Kim Jaechul Graduate School of Artificial Intelligence, the ICT Endowed Chair Professor of the School of Electrical Engineering and the Adjunct Professor of the School of Management Engineering, College of Business, all at Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST). He was the Head of the Computer Division in the School of Electrical Engineering and the Founding Director of KAIST 5G Mobile Network Research Center. Prior to joining KAIST, he was with AT&T Bell Laboratories, Holmdel, New Jersey, USA, as the Member of Technical Staff.

research_interests: His current research interests lie in decision making under uncertainty, human behavior modelling, mathematical optimization and machine learning with applications to artificial intelligence, data networks and mobile computing.

Bennett Prize Paper Awards, given to the best original paper published in IEEE/ACM Transactions on Networking in the previous three calendar years, the 2021 ACM MobiSys Best Paper Award, the 2013 IEEE SECON Best Paper Award, the 2016 KAIST Grand Prize Technology Innovation Award, and the 2016 Haedong Grand Prize Research Award, given to the Korean scholar who has made the most significant contribution to the advancement of communications research over the last 10 years. His research group at KAIST has won 3 gold, 6 silver and 4 bronze prizes at the Samsung Electronics HumanTech paper competitions.

professional_experience: o (2004~Present) Professor, KAIST, Daejeon, Korea
o (2002-2004) Principle Researcher, Korea Institute of Nuclear Safety (KINS), Daejeon, Korea
o (1996~2022) Principle Researcher, Korea Electric Power Research Institute (KEPRI), Korea Electric Power Corporation (KEPCO), Daejeon, Korea
research_interests: I'm interested in the materials-related issues in view of various nuclear power plant applications. For light water reactors, researches are focused on mechanisms of stress corrosion cracking and environmental fatigue of austenitic alloys in high temperature water. Also, recently. I developed high strength (YS ~ 1GPa) alumina-forming duplex stainless steels (ADSS) for the accident tolerant fuel cladding materials and radiation-resistant austenitic stainless steels (ARES) for nuclear applications. For generation-IV reactors, the effects of high temperature environments (helium, steam, hydrogenated steam, supercritical-CO2) on microstructure and mechanical properties are investigated. Metallic materials with high strength and oxidation resistance in those environments are of main interest. Recent activities include the development of alloys with excellent corrosion resistance in Cl-based molten salt reactors.

research_interests: Nonlinear dynamics, Stochastic process, Inference, AI, Systems biology, Synthetic biology, Biochemical networks, Circadian rhythms, Sleep, Cancer, Single-cell data, Pharamcokinetics
major_achievements: 1. Developed mathematical models to understand and regulate the circadian clock's response to temperature changes and other factors, enhancing our understanding of biological rhythms.
2. Created mathematical models and pharmacology profiles for drugs to treat diseases associated with disrupted circadian rhythms, improving drug efficacy predictions.
3. First to prove the validity of the stochastic quasi-steady state approximation (QSSA) and developed methods to identify when and how to use it effectively in biological systems.
Discovered and corrected errors in the 4. FDA's drug interaction equations, significantly improving the prediction accuracy of drug metabolism and interactions.
5. Developed software tools for biological research, including models for biological oscillators and algorithms for Bayesian inference and stochastic analysis.

research_interests: My recent intensive works focus on Computer Vision research in the fields of :

- Natural Image and Video Retoration: (1) super-resolution, (2) frame interpolation, (3) SDR-to-HDR inverse tone mapping, (4) image in-painting, (5) depth estimation, (6) image deraining, (7) image dehazing, (8) video motion debluring; (9) generative restoration of old photos;
- 3D Image/Video Reconstruction: (1) optical flow estimation, (2) camera pose estimation, (3) dynamic neural radiance field (NeRF) and Gaussian splatting learning of video for novel view synthesis;

- Satellite Image Processing: (1) PAN sharpening, super-resolution and cloud removal of Electro-Optical (EO) images, (2) super-resolution, detection and classification of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) image targets, (3) SAR-to-EO image-to-image translation learning, etc.
major_achievements: o Published 80, 120, 33 and 153 international journal, international conference, domestic journal and domestic conference papers.
o Awarded the Korea President’s Commendation at the ‘54th Invention day’ ceremony, 2019.
o Granted Innovation Research Award, "Year 2019 KAIST Research Day", 2019.
o Awarded Grand Prize for Year 2021 Research Excellence in KAIST.
o Proposed firstly the joint learning concept of multiple image restorations using CNN.
Innovation Research Award, 2019 KAIST Research Day, 23, Apr. 2019.
o Proposed firstly the in-loop filtering concept of video codecs using CNN.

o Won the winner on "PIRM Challenge on Perceptual Image Enhancement on Smart Phones – Track A: Image Super Resolution”, Perceptual Image Restoration and Manipulation Workshop (PIRM), Munich, German, 2018.
o Received a industry-special award at the 19th Korea Semiconductor Design Competition, 2018.
o Hold more than 230 registered domestic and international patents.
o Developed the world first FPGA hardware for CNN-based 2K-to-4K UHD 60fps real-time super resolution.
o Contributed 145 technical posals for ISO/IEC & ITU-T Stadnardizations.
o Hold dozens of essential patents for HEVC, VVC, and VP9/AV1 Stardards of Video Coding.

research_interests: Bioinformatics, Data Mining, Healthcare Informatics, Brain-neuro-informatics, Machine intelligence
major_achievements: o Data mining is an essential discipline for various applications including biological big data analysis, precision medicine, and healthcare informatics. This course introduces essential data mining techniques including clustering, classification, association, and deep learning along with o data preparation and performance evaluation. Students will challenge their own data mining applications as team projects so that they could consolidate their understanding of essential work elements of actual data mining.

o Biological systems consist of elements and interactions. Networks are effective models to represent them and analyze their properties. This course covers the most recent and state-of-the-art network-based techniques to analyze biological systems in their molecular, cellular, physiological, neurological and cognitive perspectives.

o The focus of this course is to provide with fundamental and essential understanding of how computers work, and what kinds of computer science techniques are available for bio and brain engineering including biological big data analysis, precision medicine, and healthcare informatics. A biomedical information system for precision medicine will be designed and implemented for hands-on experiments.

research_interests: • Neural Combinatorial Optimization

major_achievements: o From a methodological perspective, my research is divided into three main areas: developing AI based solver for (1) static (black-box) optimization, (2) dynamic control/planning, and (3) dynamic game for multi agents. I am aim to enhance generalization, scalability, and efficiency of these methods. The research focused on methodology development is primarily published at top AI/ML conferences.

o From an application perspective, my research primarily focuses on three areas: smart factories, smart transportation/logistics, and the discovery of drugs, chemicals, and materials. I aim to significantly impact the industry by solving previously intractable problems using innovative methods developed through my research. I have collaborated with experts in mechanical, aerospace, electrical, computer, and civil engineering to address a variety of challenges.

education: o 1996-2000 KAIST, Ph.D., Inorganic and Organometallic Chemistry
professional_experience: o 2023-present Deparment Head, KAIST
o 2014-present Professor, KAIST
o 2019-2020 Visiting Scholar, UC Berkeley
o 2015-2018 KAIST Endowed Chair Professor
o 2008-2014 Associate Professor, KAIST

o 2002-2004 Postdoctoral Fellow, UC Berkeley
o 2000-2002 Postdoctoral Fellow, KAIST
research_interests: Why are nanocatalysts important in green energy processes?

We are thoroughly investigating chemistry on well-defined nanostructures and surfaces. We have generated numerous nanostructures with uniform morphologies and studied various catalytic functions stimulated by renewable energy sources. We now focus on nano-assemblies for multi-dimensional functions and small molecule activation by photo- and electrochemical processes using designed nanoparticles.

Starting from the model catalysts, we explore fundamental principles of nanocatalyst design exhibiting high conversion efficiency and selectivity of energy conversion reactions, such as hydrogen generation and carbon dioxide reduction, and pursue to establish green chemical processes beneficial for human life on Earth.
major_achievements: Nanocrystal synthesis and catalytic applications
1. Plasmonic nanocrystals for sensing and monitoring
2. Photo- and electrocatalysts for energy generation
3. Nanocatalysts for organic transformation
4. Photo- and electroactive materials for storage and emission
